Description: Bronze element (handle?) from a situla (?) vessel or other object: rectangular strip with ring attached at one end, the other end flaring out into a lotus/leaf shape; three holes, two of them with rivets still attached.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Late Republican parallel (Feugère and Rolley 1991, 8-22 ). Feugère, M. and Rolley, C. 1991. La vaisselle tardo-républicaine en bronze. Dijon.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (RB.18)
